c74object.name: bach.swap
c74object.description: Swaps two elements of an llll.

inlet.digest: Address of the first element to be swapped
Address of the second element to be swapped

outlet.digest: llll with the two elements swaped

objarg.name: addresses
objarg.description: The initial addresses to be swapped, as either two address sublists, or two integers. In the latter case, they represent two addresses at the root level

method.name: bang
method.description: Perform the swap with the most recently received data.

method.name: llll
method.description:
In first inlet: the elements at the addresses set through the second and third inlets (or as bach.swap's argument) are swapped.
In second and third inlets: the addresses of the two elements to be swapped.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Address of the first element to be swapped.

entry.name: Inlet 3 (llll)
entry.description: Address of the second element to be swapped.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: llll with the two elements swaped.
